newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says signs debt accord with Norway.
newsitem.headline: Peru says signs debt accord with Norway.

text.p: The Peruvian government announced Thursday it had signed a bilateral debt restructuring accord with the government of Norway as part of a series of agreements negotiated with creditor nations of the Paris Club.
Economy Ministry officials were not immediately available to give the amount of debt involved in the accord, announced in the government daily El Peruano.
Peru has negotiated several bilateral accords after signing a preliminary restructuring agreement in July with 14 countries belonging to the Paris Club.
The most recent accord with the United States, announced Tuesday, covered $768 million of debt.
